page.title: 12Leisure in Alsagers Bank
page.content: Young people walk, bicycle and horse- ride in surrounding fields and woods. Brownies, Girl Guides and Sunday School groups flourish. There is a summer play scheme to keep children occupied during the long five-week holiday from school. Ladies can attend the monthly meetings of the local Women's Institute branch, or evening classes in pop-agility, needlecrafts or dressmaking held at the Primary School. The Cricket Club is now defunct, but the men do still have a football club. The "Gresley Arms" public house, named after the Gresley family who owned mines in this area, provides another attraction.
